instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2610 No power, exploding caps and glowing transistors on FW
threads.message:
No liquid damage, no power.

Board came in with no power, heat from around isl6258 area.
[LIST]
[*]Left it plugged in for a while to see what burned my fingers, next thing fan spins and C7798 pops, fan promptly stops, Q4260 goes red hot and removes itself from the board (melted solder).
[*]At this point I guess the fireWire is fucked!
[*]Removed Q4262 and Q4261
[/LIST]
 PPBUS_G3H read 8.4V but schematic says 6V..

Still heat coming from 6258 area, can't tell if it's from the under side or top side of the board.

Will grab some breakfast and probe around. Any ideas with the little info so far please?

threads.title: 820-2610 No power, exploding caps and glowing transistors on FW
threads.message: PPBUS should be 8.4V. Also C7771 of course!

threads.title: 820-2610 No power, exploding caps and glowing transistors on FW
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 12780"]PPBUS should be 8.4V. Also C7771 of course![/QUOTE]

Doe!.. Of course.

Many thanks.
